ingredients: 3 cups water, 2  Assam tea bags, 2  Ceylon tea bags, ⅛ cup Chinese lump white sugar, 1 (1/4 inch thick) slice fresh ginger, ½ inch cinnamon stick, 2  dried rose buds, 3 pods green cardamom, 2 pods black cardamom, 1 cup evaporated milk
directions: 1. Heat water in a small saucepan until bubbles start to form around the edges. Add tea bags. Reduce heat to a simmer. 2. Lightly crush lump sugar, ginger, cinnamon, rose buds, and cardamom pods in a mortar. Stir into the pot. Simmer until the tea bags and spices have become saturated, about 3 minutes. Add evaporated milk. Stir and simmer, without boiling, until sugar has dissolved and tea reaches the desired strength, about 8 minutes for strong tea. Strain into mugs.

name: Banana Dalgona Iced Coffee
ingredients: 2 ¼ tablespoons hot water, 2 tablespoons instant coffee granules, 1 tablespoon white sugar, 2 slices banana, mashed, ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon, or more to taste, ½ cup milk, 3 cubes  ice
directions: 1. Combine hot water, coffee, and sugar in a bowl; whip with an electric mixer until creamy. Add banana and cinnamon; mix again. 2. Pour milk into a glass; add ice cubes and top with the whipped coffee.

name: Chocolate Protein Iced Coffee
ingredients: 1 cup soy milk, 1 cup coffee ice cubes, 1 cup fresh spinach, ½  frozen banana, 1 scoop chocolate protein powder
directions: 1. Place soy milk, coffee ice cubes, spinach, banana and protein powder in a blender cup and blend until smooth.

name: Vegan Skinny Caramel Macchiato
ingredients: ½ cup almond milk, 2 tablespoons sugar-free caramel flavoring syrup (such as Torani®), 2 (1 gram) packets stevia sugar substitute (such as Truvia®), ½ cup strong brewed coffee
directions: 1. Combine almond milk, caramel syrup, and sweetener in a small saucepan and heat until hot. Froth milk mixture and add to mug, holding back froth with the back of a spoon. 2. Pour coffee over milk mixture. Add froth

name: Instant Pot® Iced Tea
ingredients: 10 ¾ cups water, divided, 1 cup white sugar, 6  tea bags, ice, as needed, 8 slices  lemon  (Optional), 8 sprigs fresh mint  (Optional)
directions: 1. Pour 5 cups of water into a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®). Add sugar and tea bags. Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 5 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build. 2. Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, for 15 minutes. Release remaining pressure carefully using the quick-release method, about 5 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid. 3. Remove tea bags and squeeze out remaining liquid into the pot. Pour tea into a pitcher and add remaining water. Serve over ice with lemon slices and mint sprigs.

name: Thai Sweet Iced Tea
ingredients: 6 cups water, 1 cup Thai tea leaves, 1 tablespoon vanilla extract, ½ teaspoon crushed cardamom pods, ¼ teaspoon crushed cloves, ¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1 ¼ cups white sugar, 1 cup half-and-half, or to taste, crushed ice, as needed
directions: 1. Bring water to a boil in a saucepan. Stir in tea leaves, vanilla extract, cardamom, cloves, and cinnamon. Cover and remove from the heat. Let steep for 15 minutes. 2. Pour tea through a fine mesh strainer; discard tea leaves. Add sugar and stir until dissolved. Cover and chill in the refrigerator for 2 hours. 3. Fill glasses with crushed ice. Pour tea into glasses and top with half-and-half.

name: Lemon-Ginger Iced Tea
ingredients: 1 cup water, 1  lemon-ginger tea bag (such as Stash®), 1 pinch white sugar, or to taste, ½ cup brewed orange pekoe tea (such as Lipton®), ice cubes
directions: 1. Bring water to a boil; add lemon-ginger tea bag. Let steep for 5 minutes. Sweeten with sugar and allow to cool. 2. Mix lemon-ginger tea and orange pekoe tea together and serve over ice.

name: White Chocolate Peanut Butter Latte
ingredients: ½ cup milk, 1 tablespoon white chocolate-flavored syrup, 1 ½ tablespoons peanut butter, 2 packets artificial sweetener, 1 cup hot coffee
directions: 1. Heat milk and sweetener in a saucepan over medium heat. Blend with an immersion blender until frothy. 2. Combine peanut butter and white chocolate syrup in a mug. Pour in hot milk, holding foam with the back of a spoon. Add coffee and foam.

name: Homemade Strawberry Jam Limeade
ingredients: 4 cups water, ½ cup white sugar, 7  limes, juiced, or to taste, 2 tablespoons strawberry freezer jam, 10  ice cubes
directions: 1. Combine water, sugar, lime juice, and strawberry jam in a blender; blend on high for 30 seconds. Add ice cubes and blend for 30 seconds longer.

name: Ginger Syrup
ingredients: 1 ½ cups water, 1 cup white sugar, ¼ cup coarsely chopped unpeeled fresh ginger, 2 tablespoons freshly squeezed lemon juice, ½ teaspoon whole black peppercorns
directions: 1. Mix together water, sugar, ginger, lemon juice, and peppercorns in a saucepan. Bring to a boil; reduce heat and simmer, stirring frequently, until sugar dissolves. Let cool, 15 to 30 minutes. 2. Strain syrup through a fine-mesh sieve; discard solids. Chill, covered, for up to 2 weeks.

name: Authentic Thai Iced Tea
ingredients: 2 tablespoons Thai tea leaves, or more to taste, 4 cups water, ⅔ cup white sugar, or to taste, ½ cup coconut milk
directions: 1. Place tea leaves in a tea filter bag and secure. 2. Pour water into a pot and bring to a boil. Add tea bag and sugar. Return to a boil and stir until sugar has dissolved, about 3 minutes. Remove from heat and allow tea to steep for 30 minutes. 3. Discard tea bag. Let tea cool to room temperature. Refrigerate for 3 to 4 hours, or overnight. 4. Fill 2 glasses 2/3 full of chilled tea. Slowly pour 1/4 cup coconut milk into each glass.

name: Instant Pot® Strawberry Iced Tea
ingredients: 8 cups water, ⅓ cup white sugar, 3  family-size tea bags, 1 pound strawberries, sliced, ice cubes
directions: 1. Combine water, sugar, and tea bags in a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®). Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 4 minutes. Allow 25 minutes for pressure to build. 2. Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid. Remove tea bags using a slotted spoon. 3. Add strawberries to a blender and puree until smooth. 4. Allow tea to cool completely. Stir strawberry puree into the cooled tea and serve over ice.

name: White Chocolate Butterscotch Mocha
ingredients: 1 tablespoon white chocolate chips, 1 tablespoon butterscotch chips, 2 (1 gram) packets stevia sweetener (such as Truvia®)  (Optional), 1 cup hot coffee, 2 tablespoons heavy cream, 1 tablespoon whipped cream  (Optional)
directions: 1. Combine white chocolate chips, butterscotch chips, and sweetener in a mug. Add coffee and heavy cream and stir until chips are melted and heavy cream is fully incorporated. Top with whipped cream.

name: Ginger-Peach Bellini
ingredients: 2 (10 ounce) packages frozen unsweetened sliced peaches, ½ cup ginger syrup, or more to taste, ¼ cup peach schnapps, 1 (750 milliliter) bottle Prosecco, 6 slices fresh peaches
directions: 1. Blend peaches, ginger syrup, and schnapps in a blender until smooth. Divide among 6 chilled 8-ounce glasses. Slowly add Prosecco, stirring gently to combine. Garnish with fresh peach slices.

name: Turmeric Iced Coffee Latte
ingredients: ¾ cup coconut milk beverage (such as Silk®), 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 2 packets stevia powder, divided  (Optional), ice cubes, 2 tablespoons water, 1 tablespoon instant coffee granules, ½ teaspoon ground turmeric, ¼ teaspoon ground ginger, ¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon
directions: 1. Pour coconut milk, vanilla extract, and 1 packet stevia powder into a glass and stir to combine. Fill glass with ice cubes. 2. Combine water, instant coffee granules, 1 packet stevia powder, turmeric, ginger and cinnamon in a microwave-safe glass; stir to mix. Microwave for 30 seconds. Stir. Continue microwaving at 15-second intervals until hot and foamy. Carefully pour over the iced coconut milk.

name: Rose Hip Iced Tea
ingredients: 4 cups water, 4 tablespoons dried rosehips, 1 tablespoon sugar, or to taste
directions: 1. Bring water to a boil in a saucepan. Add rosehips to boiling water, cover, reduce heat, 8and simmer gently for about 8 minutes. 2. Remove from heat and stir in sugar until dissolved. Leave covered to steep for 10 minutes. 3. Strain tea through a fine sieve. Cool to room temperature, then transfer to the fridge to chill.

name: Coffee Syrup
ingredients: 1 cup white sugar, 1 cup water, 3 tablespoons ground coffee
directions: 1. Combine sugar, water, and ground coffee in a pot over medium heat. Cook, stirring often, until sugar dissolves and mixture comes to a rolling boil, about 10 minutes. Reduce heat to low and cook, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes. 2. Remove from heat and let cool, about 30 minutes. 3. Place a fine sieve on top of a lidded container and pour syrup through to strain out any coffee grinds if desired. Cover with lid and store in the refrigerator.

name: Tart Rose and Ginger Tea
ingredients: 1 ½ cups boiling water, 6 slices fresh ginger root, 2 tablespoons fresh rose petals, white base trimmed off, ¼  lemon, juiced, 3 teaspoons honey, or more to taste, 2 tablespoons tart unsweetened cherry juice
directions: 1. Bring water to a boil in a small saucepan; remove from heat. Combine ginger and rose petals in a tea ball and steep in hot water for 6 minutes. 2. Pour lemon juice into a cup. Stir in honey and tart cherry juice. Pour ginger-rose tea on top.

name: Green Juice
ingredients: 2 stalks celery, ½ cup baby carrots, 1 ½ cups cold water, or to taste, ½ cup fresh spinach, 1 medium apple - peeled, cored, and sliced, ½ medium lemon, juiced, 2 small sliced fresh strawberries
directions: 1. Place celery and carrots in a pot and cover with salted water; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until tender, about 5 minutes. Drain and transfer to a blender. 2. Add water, spinach, apple, lemon juice, and strawberries; blend until smooth with only small chunks remaining, 2 to 3 minutes. Strain into a cup.

name: Copycat Sweet Iced Tea
ingredients: 4 cups boiling water, 2 family size teabags family-sized iced tea bags, 6 cups cold water, ¾ cup white sugar, or to taste, 4 cups ice cubes, or as needed
directions: 1. Combine boiling water, tea bags, and sugar in a bowl. Stir well, cover, and steep for 8 minutes. 2. Pour cold water into a pitcher. Add hot tea and stir. 3. Fill 4 glasses with ice cubes. Pour tea over top and serve.

name: Midwinter Greens Tonic
ingredients: 1 ½ cups chopped escarole, 1 ½ cups chopped spinach, 1 cup chopped kale, 2 stalks celery, chopped, ½ cup chopped Granny Smith apple, ½ cup water, 2 tablespoons lemon juice, 1 tablespoon honey, 1 (1 inch) piece fresh ginger, chopped
directions: 1. Puree escarole, spinach, kale, celery, apple, water, lemon juice, honey, and ginger in a blender until very smooth. Strain, pressing through a fine-mesh sieve. Serve immediately over ice or chill up to 1 hour and shake well to redistribute.

name: Grandma's Apple Tea
ingredients: 4 cups hot black tea, 4 cups boiling water, 4 tablespoons raw sugar, or more to taste, 1 large apple - peeled, cored and quartered
directions: 1. Pour tea into large wide-rimmed cups or 1-pint soup bowls, filling them about half full. Dilute with freshly boiled water to a golden color; add 1 tablespoon sugar per cup. 2. Place an apple quarter in each cup. Stir and serve immediately.

name: Sweet Apple Cider Vinegar Tea
ingredients: 1 cup water, 1 (2 g) bag cinnamon-apple tea, 1 tablespoon organic honey, 1 ½ teaspoons cider vinegar (such as Bragg®)
directions: 1. Heat water in a microwave-safe mug in the microwave until boiling, about 2 1/2 minutes. 2. Add tea bag to the mug and let steep for 5 minutes or desired amount of time. 3. Remove and discard tea bag. Stir in honey and cider vinegar.

name: Vietnamese Egg Coffee
ingredients: 1 large egg yolk, 2 tablespoons sweetened condensed milk, ½ cup hot strong coffee
directions: 1. Place egg yolk and condensed milk in a tall jar. Whip with a milk frother until soft peaks form. 2. Pour hot coffee into a mug and top with frothed milk.

name: White Chocolate Coffee
ingredients: ½ cup unsweetened almond milk, 1 packet stevia sweetener (such as Truvia®)  (Optional), 2 tablespoons sugar-free white chocolate-flavored syrup (such as Torani®), 1 cup brewed coffee
directions: 1. Heat milk and sugar substitute in a small saucepan over medium-low heat until simmering, about 2 minutes. Froth hot milk with an immersion blender until foamy. 2. Pour white chocolate syrup in a mug. Top with hot milk, holding froth back with a spoon. Pour coffee over syrup and spoon froth over coffee.

name: Skinny White Chocolate Coconut Iced Coffee
ingredients: 1 cup cold coffee, ¾ cup coconut milk beverage (such as Silk®), 1 tablespoon sugar-free white chocolate-flavored syrup (such as Torani®), 1 tablespoon sugar-free coconut-flavored syrup (such as Torani®), 1 packet stevia sugar substitute (such as Truvia®)
directions: 1. Pour coffee in ice cube tray(s); place in freezer until frozen solid, 2 to 4 hours. 2. Combine coffee cubes, coconut milk, white chocolate syrup, coconut syrup, and sugar substitute in a blender; blend until icy and frothy.

name: White Chocolate Cappuccino
ingredients: 2 tablespoons white chocolate chips, ½ cup milk, 1 tablespoon white chocolate flavored syrup, ½ cup hot freshly brewed coffee
directions: 1. Place white chocolate chips in mug. 2. Heat milk and white chocolate syrup in a saucepan over medium heat over a low simmer. Froth hot milk using an immersion blender. 3. Pour hot coffee over chocolate chips. Carefully pour frothed milk over brewed coffee.

name: Skinny White Chocolate Peanut Butter Latte
ingredients: 1 tablespoon sugar-free white chocolate-flavored syrup (such as Torani®), 1 cup unsweetened almond milk, 2 tablespoons powdered peanut butter (such as PB2®), 2 (1 gram) packets stevia sweetener (such as Truvia®)  (Optional), 1 cup coffee
directions: 1. Pour white chocolate syrup into a mug. 2. Heat almond milk, peanut butter powder, and sweetener in a saucepan over medium heat until simmering. Remove from heat and froth with an immersion blender. Pour milk into the mug, holding foam back with the back of a spoon. Add coffee and top with foam.

name: Tepache
ingredients: 1  whole pineapple, 1 (1 inch) piece fresh ginger, 1 cup brown sugar, 2  habanero peppers, halved, 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 8 cups water at room temperature
directions: 1. Chop pineapple into small segments, including the rind. You can remove the woody core from the segments if you wish. Add to a large container, e.g. a Mason jar with only a flat lid. The container needs to be able to expel the gas that will build up during fermentation, but also needs to be somewhat airtight to prevent the formation of vinegar. 2. Crush ginger slightly with the side of a knife to open it up. Add ginger, brown sugar, habanero peppers, cinnamon, and water to the container. Stir to combine, cover, and let stand for 2 days in a warm place until mixture slightly fizzy and warm to the touch. 3. Strain mixture through a fine-meshed sieve into fermentation-grade bottles. Cover and store in your refrigerator. Enjoy for up to 1 week. Tepache may continue to carbonate in the bottles while stored and explode if left too long.

name: Skinny Pumpkin Spice Iced Coffee
ingredients: 1 cup ice, ½ cup cold coffee, ½ cup unsweetened almond milk, 2 tablespoons sugar-free pumpkin spice coffee creamer (such as International Delight®), 1 tablespoon sugar-free pumpkin flavored syrup (such as Torani®), ½ teaspoon pumpkin pie spice, 2 (1 gram) packets stevia sweetener (such as Truvia®)  (Optional), 1 tablespoon fat-free whipped topping, or to taste  (Optional)
directions: 1. Place ice, cold coffee, almond milk, coffee creamer, syrup, pumpkin spice, and sweetener in blender cup and blend until smooth. Top with whipped cream.
